text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with cream of mushroom soup one of
my favorite soups of all time and i've
never made it on the site it is so easy
but requires a little bit of patience so
here we go you're going to take a couple
pounds of white mushrooms you can use
the brown ones if you want and you're
going to slice them up throw it in a
soup pot with butter you want to throw a
big pinch of salt in and on medium-high
heat you're going to cook these for a
long time the real key to this soup is a
long slow carmelization so after the
water dissipates they will saute just
keep it on medium low heat and just cook
cook cook until they're just beautifully
golden brown that's what gives it the
deep rich flavor at that point we're
going to throw in our onions cook that
for five more minutes at this stage I
usually take a few of the mushrooms out
the brown mushrooms the garnish the top
later optional but I like to do that and
look at that just magnificent alright at
that point we're going to add a heaping
tablespoon of flour stir that into the
fat yes that's a roux we're going to
cook that flour in the fat for just
about two minutes just to take the raw
edge off the soup is mostly thickened by
the mushrooms but this just gives it a
little extra body I'm going to slowly
lower in a bundle of fresh thyme leaves
or thyme sprigs a couple cloves of
uncrushed garlic just peeled now I got
four small ones there
but too regular large cloves of garlic
just peeled I'm going to put in a quart
of chicken stock plus one cup of water
you're going to simmer that for one hour
very slowly take out the time bundle and
then be very careful we're going to
puree this in a blender in small batches
you only want a quarter to a third of
the blender filled so it doesn't splash
out the top and just to be safe put a
towel over the top and when you start it
you just want to pulse off and on really
briefly to get it started and then you
can turn it on you want to liquefy this
the highest setting really puree it
super super fine all right once your
soup mixture has been totally pureed
you're going to add it back to the pot
going to stir in our cream now at this
point if you want you can add some more
stock or broth to thin this out
like a thick mushroom soup you might
like a thin mushroom soup do not thin
out with cream though it'll get too rich
so use chicken stock chicken broth
vegetable stock whatever some fresh
black pepper season with salt of course
to taste and by the way I don't want to
creep you out or anything but do you
know mushrooms are the only food we eat
that don't get their energy from the Sun
that's right they get their energy from
the moon anyway serve hot as they say I
mean how else would you serve in come on
I'm going to put those mushrooms I
reserved on to garnish a few more time
leaves you have to make it and see for
yourself but it is unbelievably
delicious not a lot of ingredients
nothing too fancy just pure liquid
essence of mushroom I hope you give this
a try all the ingredients are on the
site as usual and as always enjoy
you
